Articles.Content:
I just fixed a bug in my KerbTown fork that causes 1000s of errors to spam the console (and probably lags the game a bit).

You can grab the update here.

Thanks to AdmiralTigerClaw for letting me know about the issue.

That's correct

Thanks for the .cfg, it works a treat!

I was really disappointed when the krakensbane problem looked like it was going to kill this project off, but I reinstalled yesterday and hey presto, it works! Also, many more places to land at than when I first installed, so thanks to all contributing to this mod, it's great! You may all have my beans.

I just couldn't resist.

http://www.kashcorp.co.uk/snowkerbal.jpg

Oh hey! Didn't even notice arctic extras were up already! Nevermind.... Looks like it's not.....

Edited September 1, 2014 by Spacepetscompany

Oh hey! Didn't even notice arctic extras were up already! Looks great downloading now!

But it's not out?
I regularly put WIP packs in the OP. Sorry chaps, it's supposed to be a tease, not annoying. Should I not do this?
If they're clearly labeled so people know they're WiP, I don't see why not. Failure of others to read the details is no fault of your own after all.

New blog entry on making Arctic Extras here: http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/entries/1680-Making-Arctic-Extras

To tide over anyone waiting. It's nearly done!

New blog entry on making Arctic Extras here

That was a fun little read, and the last picture just looks lovely. I'm going to have to get round to making a few choppers!
Awesome! Can't wait.
Sorry, been lagging behind on my project. I'm playing with HoneyFox's Ocean Odyssey. I may be able to write a new UV map for it. I'll see if I can add it to my ocean basses addition to Kerbin Side.

And Arctic Extras is released.

The telescope for the observatory and the research dome didn't get finished by my deadline so those will have to wait for a future release. The arctic runway which I wasn't planning for this release did make this release, however.

Find the new pack in the OP.

Hope you enjoy.

EDIT - The All in 1 at Kerbal Stuff has also been updated to v0.35, and now includes the Old KSC Upgrade and Arctic Extras, as well as medsouz's latest KerbTown fork.

Edited September 3, 2014 by AlphaAsh

Looks great! I'll be sure to check it out when I get home! Also, what time are you using for the "Latest update" because unless I'm horribly wrong..... It's still the 2nd in Greenwich...

Edited September 3, 2014 by Spacepetscompany

KAA officials have completed their survey of the new South Pole Runway. However, we have found a strange anomaly: the runway is so close to the pole that the centerline calculations in our ILS software fails. Visual approaches are recommended for this runway.

http://www.virindi.net/junk/kerbinside_035_rwy.cfg

Notations:

"FW" - This is the forward direction of a ski-jump runway (flat end towards jump end).

"RV" - This is the reverse direction of a ski-jump runway (jump end towards flat end).

"X" - Runway centerline information is unreliable for this runway, use bearing only.

Edited September 3, 2014 by Virindi

Looks great! I'll be sure to check it out when I get home! Also, what time are you using for the "Latest update" because unless I'm horribly wrong..... It's still the 2nd in Greenwich...

Chap, you been playing with the TARDIS again? Today's the 3rd in old blighty as I post this.

Chap, you been playing with the TARDIS again? Today's the 3rd in old blighty as I post this.

Oh........ Now that I look at the date......... Sorry about that, getting all my dates mixed up
Oh... if Kerbals had got thier grubby mitts on the TARDIS.

Just remember.....

Today is the tomorrow we worried about yesterday.....

Jeb, just prior to a test flight.

So, I finally broke down and succumb to the wonders of Kerbinside. AlphaAsh, you're doing a marvelous job. Thank you for your efforts. I thought I'd just take a moment to let others see:

Javascript is disabled. View full album
What a gem! Will try it out!

Just remember.....

Today is the tomorrow we worried about yesterday.....

Jeb, just prior to a test flight.

It got all wibbly-wobbly-timey-wimey from there on.

So, I finally broke down and succumb to the wonders of Kerbinside. AlphaAsh, you're doing a marvelous job. Thank you for your efforts. I thought I'd just take a moment to let others see:

http://imgur.com/a/0l91X

Ahhh... turn up your terrain settings.

Ahhh... turn up your terrain settings.

Argh, yes this. I make KerbinSide with terrain settings on High. No floaty buildings then.

Here's the album I'm working on.

Javascript is disabled. View full album
Any chance of a fix for the B9 bug?

Any chance of a fix for the B9 bug?

B9 bug? That's probably a KerbTown issue, if you describe it I can look into fixing it.
